Doctor Freeman. I realize this moment may not be the most convenient for a heart-to-heart, but I had to wait until your friends were otherwise occupied. Hm. There was a time they cared nothing for Miss Vance... When their only experience of humanity was a crowbar coming at them down a steel corridor. When I plucked her from Black Mesa, I acted in the face of objections that she was a mere child and of no practical use to anyone. I have learned to ignore such naysayers when quelling them was out of the question. [breathing] Still, I am not one to squander my investments... and I remain confident she was worth far more than the initial...appraisal. That's why I must now extract from you some small repayment owed for your own survival. See her safely to White Forest, Doctor Freeman. [breathing] I wish I could do more than keep an eye on you, but I have agreed to abide by certain... restrictions. 	Mmm. Well... Now... Listen carefully, my dear. When you see your father relay these words:

Half life 2 is a very well made game. In 2004 (when this game was made) you had games like battlefront 2 2005 those types of games were all pixely and didnt look good and then half life 2 came out and took everyone by storm everyone loved half life 1 but they didn't expect this good of a upgrade from pixely crap to "Doctor Freeman" Now there are physics which almost every game uses now this game is very EPIC 10/10

I often avoid FPS games because I prefer simple  games like Tetris or Pokemon,  because I really hate the intensity in shooting games. I have always heard that half-life 2 was one of the best games ever created. The positive release of Half-Life Alyx made me re-evaluate my stance, since I really wanted to try VR out. So, I decided that Half-Life 2 would be my first FPS  shooter game. At first I did not quite understand the appeal, as most of the time it is just shooting at the bland enemy. But as I went on, one of the Chapters in this game, made me realize what it was that made Half-Life 2 special. It has a little bit of everything. From horror to simple puzzle games, if I did not like one chapter, I knew that there would be another that would be completly different in design and tone. The game never really hand holds the player, and allows the player to figure it out on their own. As a result, I would recommend this game to anyone who wants to try out this genre.
An unmissable game that has held up so well over 15 years.
